<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 4+"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Sleeves of Storage](/Equipment.aspx?ID=745)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
<trait label="Extradimensional" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=67" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 263 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn garment

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This loose robe has wide, voluminous sleeves that each contain an extradimensional space. These spaces each function as a [_bag of holding_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=249) that can hold up to 5 Bulk of items (for a total of 10 Bulk), though no individual item can be of more than 1 Bulk; the sleeves grow slightly heavy as you reach maximum capacity. You can add or remove an item from a sleeve with a single hand free as an Interact action.

 If a sleeve is completely empty, you can place your own familiar into that extradimensional space. It can survive comfortably in your sleeve for up to 1 hour, after which it begins to [suffocate](/Rules.aspx?ID=468). While in your sleeve, it can't be affected or targeted by any effects, but you don't benefit from any master abilities. A familiar can exit the sleeve of its own volition with a single action that has the [manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104) and [move](/Traits.aspx?ID=114) traits. You can't place any other creature into your sleeves, nor can you place your familiar in a sleeve if it's larger than Tiny. If your familiar is in your sleeve, you can't place any items in the sleeve.
